intro: Mallotus tenuifolius var. tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mallot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny capsules. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The leaves and fruits are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
